title: Control Theory - Closed Loop Control and System Analysis

metadata.description: A comprehensive quiz covering key concepts in closed-loop control systems and analysis of control systems.

sections.title: Section 1: Basic Concepts of Closed-Loop Control

items.question: In a closed-loop control system, what is the role of the feedback signal?
items.answer: The feedback signal is used to adjust the control input to achieve the desired output.

items.question: What is the transfer function of a control system?
items.answer: The transfer function is a mathematical representation that defines the output response of a system to an input signal in the Laplace transform domain.

items.question: What is the purpose of a Bode plot in control system analysis?
items.answer: A Bode plot is used to analyze the frequency response of a control system and assess its stability and performance.

items.question: What is the Nyquist criterion used for?
items.answer: The Nyquist criterion is used to determine the stability of a control system by analyzing the frequency response plot.

items.question: Explain the concept of feedforward control and how it complements feedback control.
items.answer: Feedforward control predicts the effect of disturbances and adjusts the control input accordingly, while feedback control corrects errors based on the actual output.
